definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out

sentences.english: One day while a rabbit was walking by a hill he heard someone calling.
sentences.chinese: 一天当兔子在山角下散步时，听到有人在呼救。

sentences.english: The drowning girl shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 那个溺水的女孩子大声呼救。

sentences.english: He was walking by the sea when he heard a voice for help.
sentences.chinese: 他正在海边散步，这时突然听到呼救声。

sentences.english: I thought I heard somebody calling for help somewhere in the woods so that I called back.
sentences.chinese: 我好像听见树林里有人在呼救，所以我也回叫了一声。

sentences.english: The emergency ward can now call directly for the competent specialist.
sentences.chinese: 现在急诊科有了呼救权，可直接点名呼请有关专家。

sentences.english: I was about to go to bed last night , when I heard a cry for help .
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我正要睡觉时，突然听到了呼救声。

sentences.english: The wounded soldier levered himself up on his elbow and shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 伤兵用肘费劲地支起身子大声呼救。

sentences.english: Jack was wounded in the legs. He levered himself up on his elbow and shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 杰克双腿受了伤，他用肘费劲地支起身子大声呼救。

sentences.english: David Drayton: Sure, as long as the machines are working and you can dial 911.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，只要那些机器还能运作，你可以打911呼救。

sentences.english: Her cries for help were deafened by the noise of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的呼救声被雷声淹没了。

sentences.english: The little mouse heard the cry.
They radioed for help when the ship was sinking.
sentences.chinese: 轮船沉没时他们用无线电呼救。

sentences.english: Its dorsal fin was in front of me. I was screaming for help.
sentences.chinese: 它的背鳍就在我的前面，我尖声呼救。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to an emergency signal annunciator for calling help for vehicles, which relates to a vehicle attachment.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型涉及一种汽车附件即汽车遇险呼救信号器。

definition: to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to save sb's life/(interj.) Help!/Save me!
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to break the door down and enter (idiom)
